WHAT ARE WE BUILDING ?

1. Centralized Data Repository

  • Consolidates data from multiple systems (ERP, CRM, Excel, databases, applications) into a single unified location.
  • Eliminates data silos and improves organization-wide data accessibility.
  • Ensures consistency in how data is stored, named, and structured.

2. Improved Data Quality & Consistency

  • Applies cleaning, validation, and transformation rules to ensure reliable and accurate data.
  • Standardizes formats, metrics, and business definitions across departments.
  • Reduces duplicate, missing, or conflicting records from source systems.

3. Faster & More Efficient Reporting

  • Provides optimized data structures (star schema, snowflake schema) for high-performance BI queries.
  • Reduces report refresh time and eliminates dependency on live production systems.
  • Enables self-service analytics in Power BI or any BI tool without performance degradation.

4. Stronger Data Governance & Security

  • Enforces unified security controls, user access management, and auditing.
  • Improves compliance with standards such as GDPR, ISO, or SOC2.
  • Ensures that data lineage, metadata, and changes are tracked and documented.

Data Warehouse On-premise

MICROSOFT SQL SERVER
MYSQL SERVER
POSTGRESQL SERVER
ORACLE DATABASE
MARIA DATABASE
And more...

1. Microsoft Dataverse

  • Enterprise apps with relational data
  • Scenarios requiring high security, controlled access, and data integrity
  • Finance, logistics, operations, HR applications
  • Dynamics 365 extensions
  • Apps needing large datasets and complex business logic

2. Microsoft SharePoint

  • Lightweight business applications
  • Task lists, employee directories, issue trackers
  • Document-based solutions
  • Teams collaboration portals
  • Apps that don’t require complex relationships or large datasets

Microsoft Cloud Services

MICROSOFT DATAVERSE
MICROSOFT SHAREPOINT

1. Microsoft PowerApps

  • Create fully customized modern UI Design.
  • Apply rules to ensure accurate input (required fields, limits, conditional validation).
  • Works with Dataverse, SharePoint, SQL, Excel, and 400+ other connectors.
  • Use formulas and Power Automate flows to handle submissions, approvals, notifications, and processing.
  • Supports role-based security, offline mode, and mobile/tablet data entry.

2. Microsoft Copilot Agent

  • Natural language data entry with actions behind the scenes.
  • No need to open PowerApps forms or SQL tools — Copilot becomes the self-service interface.
  • Enterprise security & governance that ensures safe and auditable data operations.
  • Smart AI validation & error handling
  • Support any type of data structure (JSON, PDF, TXT,...) for entry

Data Management System

MICROSOFT POWERAPPS
MICROSOFT COPILOT AGENT

1. Microsoft Power BI

  • Create interactive dashboards, charts, KPIs, and reports with drag-and-drop visuals.
  • Supports 100+ connectors: SQL Server, Dataverse, SharePoint, Excel, SAP, Oracle, APIs, cloud services, and more.
  • Stream live data from systems, IoT, databases, and business applications to monitor KPIs instantly.
  • Includes data modeling, row-level security (RLS), governance controls, and scalable cloud architecture.
  • Publish reports to Power BI Service, embed in Teams, SharePoint, or deploy to mobile apps for organization-wide insights.

Business Intelligence

MICROSOFT POWERBI

1. Microsoft PowerAutomate

  • Automates repetitive tasks such as sending emails, approvals, updating records, and syncing data.
  • Integrates Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365, SQL, SharePoint, Dataverse, SAP, APIs, custom systems, and more via 400+ connectors.
  • Includes cloud flows, scheduled flows, instant button flows, robotic process automation (RPA), and process intelligence.
  • Create workflows using a visual designer—ideal for business users and IT teams.
  • Includes built-in compliance, DLP policies, role-based access, and full audit history for secure automation.

2. Microsoft AIBuilder

  • Create and use AI models (prediction, form processing, object detection) without writing code or having ML expertise.
  • Extract data from invoices, receipts, IDs, forms, images, and documents using ready-made AI models.
  • Use historical data to predict outcomes, classify records, or score business scenarios.
  • Embed AI directly into apps or flows to automate decision-making, validation, and data entry steps.
  • Train custom AI models using your own data and reuse them across multiple applications and workflows.
